Replies.Reply: Just trying to keep you awake, Arch.
I'd stake my career on it. Anybody ever proves me wrong, I'll throw away my badge.
I'd love to have kids.
Sure.
No thanks. I have plenty.
I'd be insulted, but I know you're serious.
I'm not as dumb as I look.
I'm on duty.
Cop.
You lose.
Who can say no to a weiner?
You come here often?
Oh! Sorry.
Get something to wipe it off.
I'll get you a wet paper towel.
Hold it right there, Milo!
Police emergency! I need your car!
You take science in high school, Milo?
Then you're probably not familiar with the theory of inverse proportionate explosive dynamics.
If you fire a weapon with the barrel obstructed, the explosive force multiplies by twenty-three point five nine eight and reverses on itself with diametric polarity?
Oh yeah. Then pull the trigger, smart guy. Let's find out.
Morning sweetheart.
No thanks.
How long you been working on Lana's Mercedes, Frank?
And ya still haven't found the problem?
I know what he's doing, Lana. I wasn't born yesterday. He's not fixing your car. He's SCREWING you!
Well, you're not getting away with it, pal. I'm pulling the plug! You're fired!
You are so naive.
Yeah. Good idea.
I don't know what I'd do without you?
Laura, how long have you worked for me?
And when was the last time I gave you a raise?
Naw. That's okay. You keep it.
Laura. Laura! What is it?
Maybe we should try some prune juice.
Of course it does. But the question of my client's guilt or innocence is not the issue here today. I'm certain every member of the jury can clearly see that he's guilty!
Put yourself in his shoes. Look through his eyes. See the world the way HE sees it!
The courtroom erupts in CHEERS! Judge Allen raps the gavel.
I do.
Detective Ravine, at the time of the arrest, did you read the defendant his Miranda rights?
Of course. That's standard procedure.
Are these the cards Officer Brooks used to prompt you while reading Mr. Crumley his rights?
Yeah. These are them.
That's right.

Don't you know the difference between "can" and "may", Detective? Every school kid knows "can" is a verb that indicates ability to perform, while "may" is a verbal auxiliary indicating the permission to act.
I didn't have time to worry about past participles or interrogative pronouns! I was trying to protect society from a deranged MADMAN!
I have no more use for this witness.
Ow!
pushes the door open. It's Lola. She wears a tight white dress, long white gloves and broad-brimmed hat. The hat tips up slowly, revealing her eyes.
I got busy. Here's that paper towel I promised.
How'd you get in? The door was locked.
Only once. It was a fraternity prank. I never saw him again.
I have my car.
Not today. You don't need to wait. I'll see you tomorrow.
Try these on.
I'm on duty tonight.
Yeah. Tomorrow.
What's wrong with my office?
Stand over there and shut up!
Watch your mouth, punk! I don't want to hear language like that!
Damn birds!
I was.
Who's in my office?
Not again.
Hello, Mrs. Shady.
Gee, has it been seven years already?
Well, being locked in a tiny room with no TV can make a guy feel pretty tense.
You think?
I hate when she comes to see me.
What's that?
I don't think so.
Laura! Are you alright? That was a very long flashback you had.
You smoke too much.
It's hot tonight.
Maybe we should look for a cooler place.
What're they lookin' at?
I feel honored.
Sure. I'll drive you.
I'll follow you then.
You what?
You know, these would work a lot better if you took them out of the boxes.
Cash would be nice.
I suppose you could wash my car.
Oh, about a hundred and twenty-three.
Suppose I let you off with a warning?
Suppose I put you under arrest for being a bad girl with bad thoughts?

Suppose I do and then we lose the key and while I'm gone to get a duplicate made the house catches on fire and I can't get back to save you because the bridge is washed out and so you die a horrible death toasted like a Polish sausage on a flaming spit!
No thanks. I got a cold shower and a wife who trusts me waiting at home.
Don't forget to lock up.
I forgot my car keys.
Yes it is.
That's Madam Butterfly, isn't it?
Really? I never could understand the lyrics.
But we can't ever let it happen again. Ever!
I'd like to buy a pet.
She spends a lot of time alone. I thought it might be nice if she had something to keep her company.
I would never hurt an animal.
You do all my paperwork?
Get out of here.
He's just working through his anger, trying to find a constructive outlet.
Trust me, I spent a lot of time with him when I was preparing his case. He's really a very sweet, sensitive human being.
He gets a little melon-dramatic.
See. Loves to exaggerate.
Lieutenant Ravine.
I told you not to call me! It's finished between us. No. No, I'm not sucking anything of yours anymore!
It's done! OVER!
Wrong number.
I didn't. It's for my wife.
What?
No there isn't.
Who?
I hadn't noticed.
Where did you get that?
What are you doing with it?
Jeez, Laura, what do you use a gun for?
Why? What have you heard?
Only part of the time.
It's a little skunk. I got it at Birds-and-Skunks-R-Us.
Yeah. Got a nice ring to it. I've always liked the name Ned.
So whatdya think? You love Ned Junior as much as you love me?
I hate opera!
He's busy right now.
Your BIRTHDAY! Today? Why didn't you tell me?
Well, I'm taking you out to celebrate!
I insist. And I want to get you a nice present.
Boy, does she look stupid in that hat.
Laura's incredible. And so smart. Smart enough to recognize that Ginzu knives are the gift of a lifetime.
But she never goes out with guys. I wonder why?
Yeah. I'm driving up in the morning.
I'm a man, Laura. And all men feel passion at one time or another. Even me.
What would you think of a married man who gave in to those wild, sensual, raging desires?
What if a tidal wave of lust crashed over him and he was sucked into a vortex of wild, thrashing urges?
See you tonight, Junior.
This neighborhood is getting worse all the time! Damn kids stole my engine!
I'll just fly up.
Yeah. So?
Dammit.
I can't do it. You know how I feel about riding trains.
A short trip to hell in a metal tomb!
Yeah. I guess I can't bring them back by not riding on a train.
I guess you're right.
Twelve minutes. We'll never make it.
We're not going to make it.
I'll stand in the vestibule between the cars.
In this crazy world, there's not a whole lot a guy can count on. But when the chips are down, I can always count on you.
You risked your life to save mine. A guy can't ask any more from a woman than that.
But I saw you shoot him, Lana. In cold blood. I gotta arrest you for murder.
Sorry. I'm a cop. I have a job to do.
Don't worry, baby. I know a good lawyer.
That's a question for the arresting officer.
You'll have to ask her attorney.
Only her husband can answer that.
A lovely powder blue dress with a cinch waist, full bodice and a delicately pleated skirt.
No comment.
What's this?
"To Serve Man."
Very nice.
Judge said no bail. Don't worry. Just tell the truth, you'll be fine.
Who's gonna handle the interrogation?
Don't give us a tough time. Just spill it! What were you doing on that train?
Alright, quit playing games with us!
Who put ya up to it? Where'd you get the gun? What's your link with the CIA?
Whoa whoa whoa whoa! That's it! I will not tolerate this unwarranted badgering of my client. She'll have her day in court, gentlemen.
I want to thank you, Mrs. Ravine, for being so cooperative with these gentlemen.
Did you get all that down, Laura. Every word she said?
NO!
NOOOOO!
NOOOOOOOooooooo!!!
What?
Where's Ned Junior? WHERE IS HE?!
Leave me alone. Stay out of my face! Out of my neighborhood! Out of my LIFE!
Objection! Move to strike. Hearsay, irrelevant, stupid, idiotic, caca-
And can you tell us what this is?
A FAX in which he threatened to puree certain parts of my anatomy in a blender! I'd like to submit this into evidence.
And is this the blender you found in the lavatory of the train?
I'd like this marked as evidence.
I'm really worried about this guy. He could blow our whole case right out of the water.
No way! Uh-uh! Missed by a mile!
This is cute.
And is that the cigar in your ear?
I'd like the cigar and the head of this witness entered into evidence.
Do you want to have children?
The defense rests, your Honor.
He's sure got that right.
The "mechanic" part, I mean.
I don't know why, Arch, but I just can't shake this crazy hunch it wasn't suicide.
Yeah. Just the two of us.
I just want to talk.
No thanks. I'm driving.
Stay away from my life, my wife, my home and my pets! I'm taking Lana on a vacation and when I come back, I don't ever want to see your face again!
What are you talking about? You don't know anything about Lana?
How do you know her? Who is she to you? TELL ME!
Who is she!
Who is she!?
Liar! Who is she?
WHO IS SHE!
Him? Who, him?
You wore the same clothes?
What're you talking about? You two don't look anything alike.
You're beautiful.
They did a terrific job!
It won't work. Lana loves me.
Lana killed Frank Kelbo?
Yeah. Why? Did he burn you on car repairs too?
It was all starting to give me a headache bigger than the national deficit.
Lana?
Come on in. I'll make some tea. Grab a chair.
How about Ovaltine?
I'm way ahead of you.
So that's where she hid the Oreos.
That's the craziest thing I ever heard.
This is so unbelievable.
That damn faucet keeps turning on all by itself. I'll go check it.
WHAT?
HUH?!!!
SURE I'LL MARRY YOU! NEXT TUESDAY WOULD BE PERFECT!
Great.
Yeah, Laura?
I'm awake! Where do you come up with all that crap about women?
Are you kiddin'?
Yeah, well you're a lucky stiff, pal. Ya hold down two jobs. Got a beautiful wife waitin' for ya at home. Everything a guy could ever want, including NO kids.
What?! Rug-rats? Give me a break!
Jeez, I hate stakeouts. What makes you think Milo's gonna show up here?
And how we s'posed to recognize this scumbag?
These are the best damn Nachos in North America. Maybe the world!
I'm empty. I'm gonna get a refill. You want some?
Whoa, hold on, hoss! Take it easy. You seem a little tense tonight. What is it?
Don't worry about that.
Uh-uh.
And a damn good job, too. One of 'em even did it in Spanish.
Hey Ned! Catch this! Friend of yours.
Are you kiddin'! He'll do it! The guy's a friggin' looney!
It's a cookbook.
They're waiting for ya. They didn't want to start without her attorney being present.
Got a light?
How about a match?
You really are incredibly stupid, aren't you? I like that in a man.
You sound so sure of yourself.
Thirsty. What about that drink?
Brain surgeon?
Not me.
Two dogs. Hot.
Only when I'm in heat.
Where ya going?
That's okay. You're doing just fine.
I waited. You never came back.
Cigarette?
Yes, I know. I like things that are bad for me.
Lola Cain.
So lovely to meet you, Laura.
Don't they ever give you a night off?
Why don't we meet tomorrow evening then?
I'll let you know where.
Nothing a good interior decorator couldn't fix.
Take care of this for me, will ya?
Is it? I never know. My body heat runs about twenty degrees above normal.
A lot of them have tried that seat. You're the first one's lasted this long.
Don't. It's broken.
I brought my own car.
Now leave me alone!
I have The Clapper.
My wind chimes.
Papers. Right.
Yes. They're so confusing to me. Can you tell me what they are?
I'm so grateful. How can I ever repay you for all you've done?
Isn't there some other way?
No, I mean, isn't there something else you want? Something I could give you?
How fast was I going, officer?
Suppose you pull me over and frisk me?
Suppose I find a cop with a bigger nightstick?
Suppose you handcuff me to the bed?
You're not so tough. Last chance.
What's the matter? Don't you want me? It's the way I look, isn't it?
That's not what you came back for.
That takes care of foreplay.
Iron Butterfly. In-A-Gadda-Da-Vida.
What are you saying, Ned? That you're rejecting me, your lover, after a brief, but torrid, affair?!
I want to see you, Ned.
Who's Frank?
I had to see you, Ned. I need to feel your arms around me! I wanna suck your toes til the nails pop off!
I got us tickets to see Iron Butterfly!
Come on, Neddy-poo. Doesn't Mr. Pokey want to go exploring?
Like some ice for your drink?
Yes.
Yes!
YES! Cappelini pomodoro!
Pasta with tomato sauce. Whatsa matta? You don't like Italian?
I thought he might like to get out, so I took him to the amusement park.
You haven't seen the last of me, Ned.
I told you.
Who is it?
Why didn't you say so?
Would you like a drink?
Then let's get to the point!
So what's your problem, tough guy?
A VACATION! She doesn't deserve a VACATION! She's a brat! A bad girl! She always was and always will be!
I know EVERYTHING!
She's your wife!
She's my sister!
She's your wife!
She's my sister!
She was spoiled rotten! She stole everything I ever had. Everything! Including him.
We were identical twins.
Don't lie to me.
I look in the mirror. I can SEE!
But I found a way to get even. The best revenge possible. Destroy her marriage!
You been hangin' out with Dick Tracy, haven't ya?
It doesn't matter. I'm blackmailing her for everything she's worth. She murdered that greasy auto mechanic. I saw her do it.
Kelbo! His name was Kelbo?
Dwayne's name was Kelbo. He had a son. Frankie Kelbo.
What're you gonna do, Ned? Blow me away?
Look out! He's got a weenie!

What about it?
Yeah. So?
Ha! That's just theoretical hypothesis. Inverse proportionate explosive dynamics has never been demonstrated conclusively in a laboratory environment.
Nahhhh!
Oh yes, Frank! Adjust the stroke by ten percent! That's it.
Better watch your tongue, sweetie, or I'll have my husband arrest you.
He doesn't. That's why I need you to keep my engine tuned, Frank. Why drive a jalopy when you can have a hot rod?
Pull over and park it, Frank. I'm still under warranty.
Uh huh. Want some coffee?
Frank here was just grabbing a little before going back to work on my car.
Just the postman. He always rings twice.
Yeah, well you came to the right place.
Sit down.
On duty all night. By the time he wraps up his reports, it'll be close to noon tomorrow.
Take off the hat, Frank.
I was just reading over my husband's insurance policies. You wouldn't know anything about insurance, would you, Frankie?
I musta had my eye on something else.
How about a translation.
Meaning?
Why not?
All three?
It could happen.
Suppose it did happen?
Then we'd be rich.
That's where you come in, baby. You're gonna rig his car so it doesn't work. That should be no problem for you.
Move, Frank.
And pay attention.
No. It just came to me.
We have to be careful now. We can't risk being seen together at the house or someone might connect us to the murder later on.
Speak Yiddish.
Red Yiddish.
Zein nisht azoy meshige! Der plan iz kosher vi yosher.
Vus iz mit idr? Die host a vaichen schmoke?
Lest'n Yomkippur.
You speak Yiddish?
What happened to you last night?
You could have called. But then, I suppose you were tied up.
I never know when you're coming home, Ned. How can I ever make any plans?
So what's in the box?
What is it?
Not enough like a cat.
No kidding.
At least.
Frank? Is that you?
I told you not to call. Frank? FRANK!
Hurry up, darling. You'll be late!
Not now!
Drive carefully, sweetheart. Say bye-
What's wrong?
Why don't you catch the train to Santa Barbara? It leaves in twenty minutes.
No!
And it's fogged in.
That's right.
Fear! What about our baby, Ned? I don't want to raise a child in a home filled with fear!
Frank will drive you. Won't you Frank?
You want to earn a couple bucks, kid?
And don't let him see you.
Way to go, Ned. Right on time.
PFFFTT! Damn moths! This place could use a good exterminator.
Can't you get me out of this cage, Ned? I'm goin' buggy in here.
Do I have to answer that, Harlan?
No. Call me Angel Tits.
Someday. With the right man.
It would be difficult.
Something like that.
Well, counselor, looks like you won another case. Lucky for me.
How much for my gun?
No thanks to you.
You didn't lift a finger, Frank. You let me take all the heat.
I'm not splitting anything, Frank.
And you know too much.
You're right.
Maybe I'll just screw you to death.
A trip?
Busy man. Cop and a lawyer. When does he ever find time for you?
Maybe you should trade him in on a new model.
Want to go for another test drive?
Think I got my finger on it though.
Who's that?
I came back for my shower cap.
Where is he?
And there's a triple indemnity rider.
Aw, it's just something agents throw in so we can boost the premium. If the policy holder dies under very specific conditions, it pays off three times the face value of the policy.
See what I mean, sweetheart? What are the odds of that?
Then you'd be rich.
How we gonna do that? Didn't you tell me he hates trains?
Isn't that out of our way?
You been thinking about this a lot, haven't you?
How come we gotta meet here?
What?

Yo! Ober mir darfen imvarfen in tsug. Un schissen un schtippen in vasser arein. Oy a broch! Mir zenen git bakackt.
Ven hob ich gehat a vaichen schmoke?
Nu shoin, ein mul. Es paseert tsie yeyden man.
Oy! Mir vellen zein oif groise tsures. Me'vet unz chap'n.
It's all taken care of. When do I knock on the door?
I was in the neighborhood. Thought I'd stop by and pick up my tools.
Sure, I'll take you to the train station.
We'll make it!
Come on, Lana. You're not gonna shoot me.
Now you're talkin' baby.
Right here. The judge decided to skip arraignment and take Milo direct to trial. You're six minutes late, but don't sweat it. You got Judge Allen. He's always eleven minutes late.
Really?
Wear the blue one.
I'll get that.
It's getting late. I'll give you a ride home, Ned.
I'll tow you.
I'll call from home.
Max Shady's mother.
Sure.
Oh my God, Ned.
Extreme peril. You know, the risk of personal bodily harm.
Your insurance file. But the policy's missing. Did you take it home?
She called. Wondered why you never came home last night. I told her you were working with a client, undercover.
Were you?
There's lipstick on your collar.
Lola Cain.
Yeah, I noticed how you hadn't noticed.
That's alright. She noticed enough for both of us.
I worry about you, Ned. I worry a lot.
Max Shady's been faxing death threats to you all morning.
Wait. It might be him.
From my purse.
Handing it to you.
You shoot it. A bullet comes out. Gosh, Ned, after all your years as a cop, I'd think you'd know these things.
Is this another sick joke from Max Shady?
Lola Cain.
I'll put these in water for you.
It's not important. I just had one last year.
Oh no no! It's no big thing. I'll have another one sometime.
You're so sweet. You don't have to. You gave me a present last year. Those lovely Ginzu knives.
If I told him how I really feel, he'd probably fire me. What am I saying? He probably doesn't even know I exist.
That's alright. I was just rambling.
He's so cute. He can't even look me in the eye.
What is it, Ned? You can tell me.
Really?
They're just doing their job.
Yep. Both of 'em.
Yes. It's a death threat that Max Shady FAXED to you on the day he was released from prison.
No you didn't!
I don't believe it! She just bought her gun back! The gun she used to kill a man!
Ned! I'm glad you're here. I have so much to tell you.
A lottery ticket and a laundry receipt.
I found them in the pocket of that suit you wore the night you were working under cover with a client.
You remember that night, don't ya Ned? Then it hit me. Lottery starts with L-O. Laundry starts with L-A. L-
Don't sweat it. It's the way a woman's mind works.
Fine. Then I remembered you told me some guy named Frank had been working on your wife's car for two months. You with me so far?
Ned, Lana wasn't trying to save your life when she shot Max Shady. She and Frank were plotting to kill you and collect on your insurance policy. But she shot the wrong guy.
Well, hang on to your jock strap, Ned. There's more.
Your lovely wife, Lana, murdered both of Helen Shady's sons.
And you haven't even heard my story.
Okay. I'll make the Ovaltine.
Those are MY panties!
Oh Ned!
Oh Ned, I love you. I always loved you!
Got 'em!
THEY'RE DEAD! GONE! KA-PUT!
Okay. But I want to have kids.
Knock off the chatter, will ya?
We won't need you anymore.
We can make our own music.
SCREAMING out in terror! Ned rushes in, shaking her.

I can't.
Bailiff. Pass these out.

Do you swear to tell the truth, the whole truth and nothing but the truth, so help you God?

Do you swear to tell the truth, the whole truth and nothing but the truth so help you God?

I object!

Ma!

Laura hugs Ned again, arms locked around his neck, still gripping a gun in each hand.
Ned and Laura still embrace, her forearms crisscrossed behind his neck. It's been a long embrace.
